channel.title: Incremental In PHP is it possible?
channel.description:
Hey guys so i was trying to develop an incremental game like cookie clicker and etc.. but multiplayer so i was thinking php for the following:
Register Log in Profile Leader boards Chat
My problem is how about would i go storing data if i made the game using javascript like most are, I would want the data to be stored to that user profile that way if the user signs in on a diffent account they would have there data or even better make it so its not js but the game itself is php there for the user cannot edit the js and cheat

item.title: Incremental In PHP is it possible?
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

DigitalOcean is a great choice for getting setup since they have pre-installed stacks you can just use once you create your droplet.

Read full topic
item.source: Incremental In PHP is it possible?

item.title: Incremental In PHP is it possible?
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

youd save a lot by buying a webhost rather than a vps. if you host locally, and forward everything correctly/have the right stacks installed you can save the most money but youre obviously more prone to downtime.

if youre planning on hosting more than just this website, ie rsps or something else - get tge vps

Read full topic

item.title: Incremental In PHP is it possible?
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

Yes it’s possible but there are much better alternatives. If you’re looking to use pure JS look at Node and Express, there are plenty tutorials and documentation is widely available for database manipulation. Something like this would be a good start point.

Read full topic
